intro: Euphrasia arctica var. mollis, commonly known as the Arctic eyebright, is a low-growing herbaceous plant native to Arctic and alpine regions. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically has hairy, succulent leaves that help it retain moisture in cold, dry environments. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions. Euphrasia arctica var. mollis is often found in tundra and mountainous habitats across the northern hemisphere.
